openingPriority.description: Which numbers to close first when the game begins
openingPriority.reason: Higher numbers are worth more points - close them first to prevent opponent scoring

whenAhead.description: Strategy when you have more points than opponent
actions: Don't give them opportunities to score
whenAhead.reason: Cut off their scoring while maintaining your lead

whenBehind.description: Strategy when opponent has more points
whenBehind.reason: Need to outscore them before game ends

actions: Close numbers close to being finished
Open new numbers for scoring potential
whenTied.reason: Maintain flexibility while preventing opponent advantage

defensiveMode.1: Find opponent's highest open number they can score on
defensiveMode.2: Calculate marks needed to close it
defensiveMode.3: If can close in 1 dart, close it
defensiveMode.4: If can close in 2 darts, start closing
defensiveMode.5: If can't close in turn, consider scoring instead

offensiveMode.1: Find your highest open number you can score on
offensiveMode.2: Calculate how many points behind you are
offensiveMode.3: Score aggressively on highest open number

balancedMode.1: Find numbers where you have 2 marks
balancedMode.2: Close these with 1 dart if possible
balancedMode.3: Otherwise, work on highest unclosed number
balancedMode.4: Watch opponent's progress on their 2-mark numbers

interpretation.3.0+: Excellent - closing one number per turn on average

treble.description: Closes a number in one dart
treble.whenToUse: When you need to close quickly or score big

double.whenToUse: Less risky than treble, good for steady progress

bull.description: Save bulls for last - harder to hit

tips: Don't be afraid to score when behind
Close opponent's numbers before they can score
Triple-20 is often the best first dart in Cricket
Bulls are worth 25 points - don't ignore them when scoring
